M4 test pass (I20041214-2000-gtk)

1. have the type below
2. move 'method' to 'Inner'

-> get the exception below

--------- Test.java --------

package com.example.m4testing;


public class Test {
	static class Inner {
		private Object fObject;

		public boolean check() {
			return true;
		}

		public Object get() {
			return fObject;
		}

		public void set(Object object) {
			fObject= object;
		}
		
	}
	
	/**
	 * Execute da stuff.
	 * 
	 * @param inner the target
	 */
	void method(Inner inner, int size, int... numbers) {
		if (inner.check()) {
			inner.set(inner.get());
		}
	}
	
	boolean localCheck() {
		return true;
	}

	public void caller() {
		Inner inner= new Inner();
		
		method(inner, 4, 3, 2, 1, 0);
	}
}


--------- Exception --------

Hmmm, other refactorings might fail as well. Basically we have to check every
refactoring in the light of varargs.

Not critical for M4 since varargs are for sure an open issue with refactoring
(extract method doesn't behave well either).

Its actually not a vararg problem, but an issue with primitive types

Fixed > 20041216
